employments.summary:
Wrote Groovy & PowerShell Jenkins jobs for vCloud Automation Center
provisioned Environment on Demand (EoD) deployments
 Performed   business   analysis   to   help   development   communities
determine approaches to automate their application build processes
 Consulted   with   traditional   operations   teams   to   remediate   multiple
severity 1 security vulnerabilities
 Troubleshot Java applications to ensure consistent deployments with
integrity checks
 Fostered collaboration between team to build Infrastructure­as­a­Service
efforts toward single interface DevOps deployment solutions

* Apprenticed managing Splunk (v5 & v6) services
* Refined infrastructure to expedite end customer support
* Explored prototyping several mobile device emulation laboratories
* Provided verbal & written guidance to Junior staff

* Performed Red Hat Enterprise Linux (version 3 - 5.3) KickStartTM & Solaris (version 8 - 10) JumpStartTM builds with additional proprietary software
* Maintained BIND DNS, SendmailTM, ApacheTM, TomcatTM, & Oracle 10gTM database servers for multiple government agencies
* Forecasted growth, and reported to management for multiple government agencies
* Enhanced system builds with custom security configuration files using a semi-automated process for Disaster Recovery & Intrusion Detection purposes
* Evaluated security postures with DISA Security Techinical Implementation Guides (STIGs) & Security Readiness Review (SRR) scripts, tcpdump, WireSharkTM, and a review of firewall settings for multiple government agencies
* Investigated penetration attempts on corporate & customer networks while serving as a secondary firewall administrator for multiple government agencies
* Rendered MS-VisioTM schematics to show network topology & access points for penetration attempts
* Built NISPOM compliant networks as the Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) by defining server profiles merged with NSA, DoD, & custom specifications
* Wrote PERL scripts to collect data from network servers
* Administered authentication services for Unix, Linux, & Windows users
* Continued work started at Nichols Research Corp.

* Planned logistics to establish a team of 50+ engineers for managing & maintaining approximately 2300+ servers for Residential Email Services
* Collected inventory & statistical data routinely via the various deployment solutions used (e.g. CFEngine v2.x, Puppet, SSH-based tools)
* Tailored Puppet modules for the inventory software deployments & provided recommendations to the infrastructure teams
* Facilitated repair & acceptable preventative maintenance of End-of-Life Sun T2000 hardware with junior staff using Agile methodologies
* Recovered MySQL 5.x Enterprise databases and restored replication services
* Deployed & modified LDAP schemas for CA DXGrid

* Assisted in troubleshooting HP OpenView monitored faults (e.g. system controller, memory, & other hardware)
* Provided verbal & written guidance to Junior staff
* Recovered & reconfigured Red Hat Satellite servers for more consistent deployments
* Provisioned VMWare ESX 4 hosted servers for security & application development teams
* Analyzed RHEL 5.x servers for performance tuning requirements with suggestions for additional hardware resources (e.g. RAM) when necessary
* Queried Oracle-based inventory databases to determine where critical data was missing in preparation for a hardware refresh

* Performed Solaris JumpStartTM builds (version 2.6 - 9) with additional proprietary software
* Reduced system build & Disaster Recovery cycles by more than 50%
* Created NIS+ & local accounts for customer use of proprietary systems
* Developed multi-tier applications with C/C++, PERL, & Sybase SQL queries to aid in maintaining the proprietary software
* Acted as the primary Configuration Management Specialist for a large portion of the project
* Generated documentation via PERL for proprietary software
* Debugged software & system vulnerabilities using network monitoring tools such as snoop, SnareTM, & BlackIceTM
* Detected penetration attempts on corporate & customer networks, and isolated allegedly compromised systems to determine if further investigation was needed Travel Possibilities Weekly, up to no more than 50%

* Initiated security scans & remediation on Red Hat Enterprise Linux builds (version 3 - 5.6) using Tenable's SecurityCenter & the Center for Information Security's benchmark scripts
* Provided secondary support for the Premium Support Linux Administrators
* Instantiated MySQL databases for storing security remediation statistics & wrote correlating stored procedures
* Assisted in Oracle database administration during On-Call Duty and special projects
* Functioned as Satellite Administrator for our Red Hat Satellite Server instance

* Crafted an RPM Management system of customized scientific software on CentOS (version 5 & 6) for a clients' Business Process Management for their government customer
* Forged a proof of concept workstation with Ubuntu Linux, Oracle's Virtual Box, and some CentOS Virtual Machines to show how the RPM Management system would work for a long term solution
* Composed scripts for system monitoring & security procedures on Red Hat Enterprise Linux builds (version 4 & 5) for various clients
* Continued work started at Mnemonic Systems Inc.

offers.message:
Hi Brian, 

Hope you're doing great! 

My name is Toma and work in the Tech Recruitment team here at Booking.com, the planet's #1 accommodation site. 

I came across your profile here on Hired.com and your experience in both systems and software engineering could prove to be very interesting for our new Site Reliability Engineering function in Seattle. 

Would this be something you would consider at this point in your career? 
If so, I'd be happy give you a better view on what Booking.com can offer over a quick phone chat. 

In the meantime, I'll leave you with this Youtube video we made to meet the team: https://youtu.be/i7S10eO4ZnY

Have a good one!
Toma
offers.comment:
Hello Toma:

I would definitely be interested in this opportunity!  I'm currently looking at interviewing with 2 locations of your company (Seattle & Amsterdam).  My skill sets would definitely be a good match for your company, and I'm sure that there would be a good cultural fit as well.

Here are some times which I'm available to discuss it.  There may be times next week, but those times are still being determined.

Thu 12/14 - 3pm-6:30pm

Fri 12/15 - 9am-11:30am, 3pm-6:30pm

-Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE
offers.search_content: Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE Site Reliability Engineer 130000.00

offers.message:
Hi Brian,

This is Dustin, technical recruiter at OfferUp in Bellevue, WA. We are building out our SRE team, and are looking for folks who have an interest in both maintaining our prod environment, as well as designing features and coding (deployment processes, routing layer, monitoring, tooling, etc).

OfferUp is the most valuable VC backed startup in WA state at $1.2B, and we are projecting significant growth for the future.

Let me know if you want to chat!

Thanks,
Dustin
offers.comment:
After being introduced to OfferUp services by my brother, I'm definitely interested in learning how my skill sets can help the company succeed.  I bring many years of programming, systems engineering, security, & automation experience for both Linux & Windows environments.

Here are some available times to discuss this opportunity:

Mon 12/11 - 4:30pm-6:30pm

Tue 12/12 - 9am-11:30am, 3pm-6:30pm

Wed 12/13 - 9am-11:30am
offers.search_content: Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE Site Reliability Engineer 123000.00 Yes - stock options

offers.message:
Hey Brian, at Beam we're building the next generation digital bank, and I'd love to talk with you about a ground floor role in DevSecOps. 

Here's the job description:
https://angel.co/meetbeam/jobs/307864-head-of-devsecops

Please let me know if you'd be interested!

-Karim
offers.search_content: Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE Head of DevSecOps 123000.00

offers.message:
I hope you're well. I wanted touch base with you regarding a career opportunity with Capital One.  Based on your extensive Sr. DevOps Engineering background I thought you might interested to learn about similar opportunities with Capital One.

As I am sure you can imagine, more and more organisations are looking to own their Software Development. Here at Capital One we want to be known as a tech company within the financial industry. We have built Software Development centers across our footprint and are heavily invested in tech growth, continuously looking to identify top talent. Capital One are currently in a very exciting phase and we're growing in all things tech. 

Please let me know if you might be interested in learning more about the opportunity.

Cheers,
James
offers.search_content: Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE Master Software Engineer, CI/CD 123000.00

offers.message:
Hi Brian,

I'm CEO of a Stanford startup which helps students manage their financial needs (from govt aid to banking products to internships, while educating them on each). We're live in 250 schools, revenue generating & have just raised our seed round. We're a team of two Stanford and two Carnegie Mellon grads looking for a Dev Ops engineer (we're also separately hiring a third back end engineer, two front end engineers and an AI lead). Would you be interested in speaking?

We're passionate about our product and know it will have an impact, because it's what we wish we could have used.

Base salary would be between $70-100,000 with equity compensation of 0.5-1%. I know this is less than your preferred base but this would also be a unique chance to join as a member of the founding team.

Charlie
offers.comment:
While Java has never been my primary programming language at any place that I've worked, I'm certain that I have many skills which could be leveraged to make us all successful!  Let's start the process!
Fri 12/08 - 4pm-6:30pm

Mon 12/11 - 3pm-6:30pm

Tue 12/12 - 9am-11:30am

offers.message:
Hi Brian,

my name is Antek Baranski (https://www.linkedin.com/in/antekbaranski/) I am a senior engineering director with Roblox in San Mateo. I manage the SRE, InfoSec and build/release automation teams and for the build/release team I am looking for someone with your skill set.

Our team consists of people with 12+ years of experience each and we have some hard problems to solve for our development organization as we are growing like crazy.

Reading your profile here on hired.com your past experience aligns well with what my team and I are looking for to help us grow and scale.

regards

Antek
offers.comment:
Hello Roblox!  I'm definitely interested in knowing more about this position and how my experience with programming & automation could help the team.  I take pride in providing user friendly tools with optimized code & better (not necessarily best due to customer requirements) security practices so that the business can function as needed.  Let's find a time where we can discuss this possibility!

Mon 12/11 - 4:30pm-6:30pm

Tue 12/12 - 9am-11:30am, 3pm-6:30pm

Wed 12/13 - 9am-10am
offers.search_content: Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE Tools Engineer 170000.00 Yes

offers.message: Hi Brian, we're impressed by your background! We'd love to learn more about your career goals and interests and we'd love the opportunity to tell you about what we're building.  Let us know when would work for an intro call.
offers.comment:
As someone who has always wanted to work at places which reduce/prevent forest fires, this sounds like at least a technological match to me!  Just call me Smokey the Bear, but only you can help prevent forest fires by interviewing/hiring me!  I'm intrigued to know more about your corporate culture!

Typically "forest" refers to Windows Active Directory systems, but I prefer Linux systems to create adaptable/customizable solutions which use Kerberos from Active Directory.
offers.search_content: Brian Plunkett, CISSP-ISSAP, RHCE DevOps Engineer 123000.00 Yes, after trial period

profile.headline: DevOps Engineer seeking creative opportunities!
profile.summary:
##Genetic Predisposition##

----------

From [Tadpole][1] to [TOAD][2], I've learned to take my knowledge of languages, programming, & computers to cumulatively build myself and many [service environments][3] to sustainable, [capable maturities][4].  This has supported several endeavors as listed below.

> **Supported Endeavors**
>
>  - Forensic Science
>  - Intelligence Collection
>  - Telecommunications
>  - Scientific Research
>  - Global Commerce

It is literally in my blood as both my mother & father have programmed computers throughout their careers.  Upon my request, I took my first programming course when I was 12 years old, and the world has become endless possibilities.

##The Next Evolution##

----------

If possible, I'd like to put my amphibious (i.e. manual) days behind me.  While I can swim with the rest, I want to stretch my legs in one or more of the following pursuits.

> **Non-trivial Pursuits**
>
>  - **DevOps** or **Linux** Engineer (w/ automation of common tasks)*
>  - **Security** Architecture (e.g. Static or Dynamic Intrusion Detection)
>  - **Lead** or Manager (e.g. 1 - 4 junior members)
>
> *Less [BASH][5], and more [PERL][6] or [Python][7]!

*Despite mixed biological metaphors, I hope that you've appreciated the humor in this summary.*


  [1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tadpole_Computer "Tadpole"
  [2]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toad_%28software%29 "TOAD"
  [3]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satellite_%28software%29 "Red Hat Satellite Server"
  [4]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capability_Maturity_Model_Integration "CMMI"
  [5]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bash_(Unix_shell) "BASH"
  [6]: https://www.perl.org/ "PERL"
  [7]: https://www.python.org/ "Python"
profile.job_search_reason: After having some great experiences helping teams maintain many varieties of Unix & Linux systems, I'd love to do more work in development and/or automation!  If the position could also make use of my knowledge of perimeter-based security, that would be even better!
profile.place_preferences: I tend to prefer coastal cities, but make exceptions to places I consider fun (e.g. Phoenix, Austin, Albuquerque).
